text: Hi, is it possible to have a range slider in a HS Form?
only through faking it. and it’s not easy

Does HubSpot video support closed captions?

morning everyone. i feel like i am missing something fundamental here. if each of our newsletters is its own subscription type, is there no way for me to create a simple form, say just email address and name, and have it so on form submission, a specific subscription type gets added to the contact? the only way i see to do it now is to add the subscription type at the end as one of the "Notice and Consent / Legitimate Interest" options. but we can't pre-check them nor require them checked. so it's possible someone submits a newsletter sub form without me being able to send them the newsletter!?
I think that depends on some GDPR settings. not sure

Anyone having major caching issues this week? We have multiple pages of content that won’t publish but we CAN SEE the content is there in the page editor. This process seems to always be a nightmare with HubSpot.

And now, we get page cannot be saved errors and all the buttons are grayed out.

Has anyone seen this behavior before?

if you are seeing issues where the page cannot be saved or published while you’re in the editor that’s not a caching issue. that’s likely an issue with the javascript in the editor. You should reach out to support for that kind of issue.

for normal caching issues you can add a query parameter to see the updated version of the css/js/images. There’s also a google chrome <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension>  which makes this easier/faster <https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/HubSpot-developer-extensi/gebemkdecnlgbcanplbgdpcffpdnfdfo>
Thanks <@U7SL518D6> - we haven’t added any scripts and all of the pages up to 1 hour ago did not have this same problem. We have reached out to support also.
Has anyone created a repeater field inside of a repeater field in the custom module tool? I am struggling to figure out the correct syntax in regards to the for loops. Any thoughts?
Your inner loop would reference the current instance of `item`, so something like `for item2 in item`
QUESTION - :thinking_face::thinking_face::thinking_face: When using external libraries, is it better to simply link to the external library, or download it and install it into the portal???
Depends, my rule of thumb is if I'm using a certain version, I'll download it and link to it through the portal. If it's something I want updated by a third-party or something, then I'll link to it.

depends on the situation. for security reasons having it in your portal is better. for speed reasons CDNs like cdnjs are really fast, and odds are the user already has the file cached if it’s a commonly used library.

I use require_js if using a cdn’d file, but when a good cdn is not available I create a file in HubSpot and paste the unminified version of the code in and link that file. (unminified because the HS minifier doesn’t like already minified code.)
ditto what Mark said about versions
speaking of which been casually requesting it every now and again. It’d be really nice if when we use require_js, we could add attributes to be injected into the script tag

Here’s an example of what I’d like to be able to output:
`<script src="<https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/vue/2.5.17/vue.js>" integrity="sha256-3kjowa0CUPPK4W+yaGpNP1exjs8gbX2SSsToEMd06K8=" crossorigin="anonymous"></script>`
the integrity bit is a security feature, in-case CDNJS ever gets hacked and someone updates that file, the file would stop getting loaded on our HS sites
If you copy the snippet of the first group it will give you the correct layout.
thanks for the ideas guys! All of that makes sense.
